## CALCULATION of CO2e
https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10021-021-00631-x (Ref.)

## Constants
seconds per year = 31 536 000 s
seconds per day = 86 400 s


# S/GWP (kg CO2e per kg GHG): CO2=1; CH₄ = 45; N₂O = 270

JWP sum of GHG fluxes: &lt;&lt; mean

# Mean CO2 fluxes 1.23 µmol m-2 s-1. 
the mean annual co2 flux is:1.23 * 10^-6 

# Mean CH4 fluxes=  -0.87 nmol m-2 s-1. 
The mean annual flux]

# Mean N2O fluxes= -0.083 nmol m-2 s-1. [This should be the mean or median
#annual flux]

Equ. To calculate CO2-e
CO 2 e (gasx)= Annual Mean Flux (gas x ) x S/GWP (gas x )                                
# Steps of calculation:
 1) CO2-e (g-CO2) = (1.23 * 10^-6) umol m-2 s-1 * 44 gCO2 molCO2-1 * 1 kgCO2e
kgGHG-1
CO2e= 0.00005412 g m-2 s-1 or 0.00000005412 kg m-2 s-1 or 1.71 kg m-2 y-1

 2) CO2e (ch4) = (-0.87 * 10^-9 nmol m-2 s-1) * 16 gCh4 molch4-1 * 45 kgCO2e kgGHG-1
CO2e(ch4) = -0.0000006264 g m-2 s-1 or -0.0000000006264 kg m-2 s-1 or -0.020 kg
m-2 y-1

 3) CO2e (n2o)= Flux (gas x ) x S/GWP (gas x )
 CO2e (n2o) = (-0.083 * 10^-9 nmol m-2 s-1* 44 gN2o moln2o-1 * 270 kgCo2e kgGHG-1
CO2e (n2o)= -0.000000986 g m-2 s-1 or -0.000000000986 kg m-2 s-1 or -0.031 kg m-2 y-
1
CO2e (co2+ch4+n2o) = 1.71 + (-0.020)+ (-0.031) -->  1.659 kg m-2 y-1.
this is the GHG balance!

# Scale up to JWP area 2 ha or 20 000 m-2

CO2e= (1.659 kg m-2 y-1 * 20 000) --> 33180 kg y-1 or 33.18 t y-1
